intro: Urera stimulans, commonly known as the stimulant urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
